content.text: Several bug fixes have been implemented in the ElizaOS repository, including fixes for Bedrock inference (PR #3553), a typo correction (PR #3551), addressing a race condition (PR #3549), and improvements to Twitter vitest functionality (PR #3543).

New features have been added, including interaction vitest improvements (PR #3550), a Telegram test suite (PR #3538), Discord and Twitter end-to-end testing (PR #3579), database-driven character management (PR #3573), and Discord test channel configuration (PR #3559).

Documentation improvements include updates to the README for model plugins (PR #3542), cleanup of documentation (PR #3584), addition of SQLite3 error information to the Quickstart guide (PR #3539), and correction of branch naming examples in CONTRIBUTING.md (PR #3532).

Refactoring and other changes include the removal of Anthropic local embed (PR #3540), vector dimensions and character schema updates (PR #3486), improved database operation handling (PR #3581), trimming of <think> blocks from Ollama responses (PR #3545), and a refactoring of the Plugin Local AI (PR #3526).

categories.title: Recent Issues in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub Repository

content.text:
Several issues have been reported in the elizaOS/eliza GitHub repository, covering various technical problems and feature requests:

1. Build failures: Issue #3556 reports an error where the build command exited with code 137, suggesting a potential memory-related crash.

2. Plugin requests and issues: Users have requested plugins for notion.so (#3547) and merkle (#3564), while another user reported problems with file uploads in the 0G plugin (#3576).

3. Search functionality problems: Issue #3546 documents a RAG (Retrieval-Augmented Generation) Search Error.

4. Connection and configuration issues: Multiple users are experiencing connection problems between frontend and backend (#3578), issues with port configuration when using environment variables (#3569), and node module installation errors (#3571).

These issues highlight ongoing development challenges in the eliza project, spanning build processes, plugin ecosystem, search functionality, and basic connectivity.

categories.title: Recent Pull Requests in the elizaOS/eliza Repository

content.text: Several new plugins have been introduced to the elizaOS/eliza repository. Ben-dh3 submitted PR #3554 adding a new Zapper plugin. Meanwhile, andriyk-hacken contributed two related PRs: #3544 adding an Extractor Agent Firewall plugin and #3534 for a plugin-extractor feature.

Other recent contributions include PR #3537 by qiaqiatic updating the prompt for drama creation, PR #3568 from tercel titled 'Main tercel', and PR #3584 by madjin focused on documentation updates and cleanup.

The elizaos/eliza repository showed increased activity over a two-day period. From February 17-18, 2025, there were 16 new pull requests with 9 merged, 3 new issues, and 23 active contributors. Activity increased the following day (February 18-19, 2025) with 18 new pull requests (10 merged), 8 new issues, and 29 active contributors. This represents growth in all metrics, with a particularly notable increase in new issues and active contributors.

The provided sources mention 'Top contributors for elizaOS/eliza' but do not provide any specific details about who these contributors are or their contributions to the project. Without additional information, it's not possible to generate a detailed summary about the individual contributors, their roles, or the nature of their contributions to the elizaOS/eliza project.
